title: Drawing, "The Life Boat, study for watercolor, "Wreck of the 'Iron Crown'"", 1881
medium: Point of brush and black ink, brush and black wash, black chalk, brush and white gouache on heavy off-white wove paper
markings: Verso: Stamped in brown, at bottom center: Cooper Union Museum New York, Lugt 457e.
signed: Recto: Signed in black chalk, lower left corner:  HOMER
inscribed:
Recto: Inscribed in black chalk, barely visible, at lower left margin: Sketch from nature, October 14, Homer [illeg.] 1881.

Verso: Inscribed in graphite: 27 / 35241-2.
creditline: Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.
description: Horizontal view of men in oil skins rowing a boat at lower right, against rough sea, toward ship on horizon at upper left; ship vaguely indicated. Lower 1/5 of sheet is empty and is divided from image by thin black line.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "The Life Boat, study for watercolor, "Wreck of the 'Iron Crown'"", 1881.
1881. Point of brush and black ink, brush and black wash, black chalk, brush and white gouache on heavy off-white wove paper. Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.. 1912-12-130.
